findings: Severe osteoporosis (Z-scores: L2â€“L4, -5.6 SD; femur neck, -3.9 SD).
End-plate compressions of thoracic vertebrae (T7, T9, T10, T12).
Increased bone-specific alkaline phosphatase and low urinary calcium excretion.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After 2.5 years of treatment with risedronate, bone mineral density and back pain improved.
